questions.question: Does the entire body of the dog exhibit a uniform, polished wood texture with visible grain patterns that follow the contours of the figure, without abrupt transitions or unnatural patches?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the dog's body exhibits a consistent polished wood texture with visible grain patterns that align with the contours of the figure. The texture appears smooth and uniform across the entire body, and there are no visible abrupt transitions or unnatural patches. This visual cue is indicative of skilled wood craftsmanship, as the grain patterns contribute to the aesthetic by complementing the sculpted form of the dog.

questions.question: Is the black-and-white facial pattern accurately represented by distinct dark and light wood tones along the central vertical line of the face, with no smudging or misalignment?
questions.explanation: The facial pattern in Image B is clearly defined with distinct wood tones representing the dark and light areas. The central vertical line of the face separates these tones effectively without any smudging or misalignment. The precision with which these tones are applied highlights attention to detail in the representation of the facial pattern, maintaining clarity and symmetry in the design.

questions.question: Are the facial features—such as the eye sockets, nose bridge, and mouth outline—accentuated with fine, realistic carved lines that enhance depth without distorting proportions?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the facial features are accentuated with fine carved lines that add depth to the eye sockets, nose bridge, and mouth outline. These details are executed with precision, ensuring the proportions of the face remain intact. The carving adds realism to the wooden sculpture by providing depth and shadowing effects without distorting the overall structure of the face.

questions.question: Do all body parts—head, ears, legs, and paws—maintain smooth, rounded contours consistent with the original form, without flattened areas or sharp edges that suggest poor carving?
questions.explanation: Image B shows that all body parts such as the head, ears, legs, and paws maintain smooth, rounded contours, consistent with the figure's design intentions. There are no flattened areas or sharp edges, which indicates skilled carving and attention to detail. The smoothness of the contours ensures the sculpture maintains a cohesive and aesthetically pleasing form.

questions.question: Is the dog placed on a flat, minimalist wooden platform that matches the material tone and finish of the figure, with proper grounding and consistent lighting shadows?
questions.explanation: In Image B, the dog is set on a flat, minimalist wooden platform that has a similar material tone and finish as the figure. This choice complements the sculpture and indicates thoughtful design considerations. The lighting casts consistent shadows, demonstrating good grounding and uniform light distribution that enhances the overall presentation of the sculpture.
